Swing.DionesusWindow module¶

class Swing.DionesusWindow.DionesusWindow(dataframe, window_info, td_window, explanatory_dict, response_dict)[source]¶

Bases: Swing.Window.Window

A window that runs Dionesus as the network inference algorithm. The PLSR function is from sci-kit learn for implementation consistency between window types

For more information about Dionesus see:

Ciaccio, Mark F., et al. “The DIONESUS algorithm provides scalable and accurate reconstruction of dynamic phosphoproteomic networks to reveal new drug targets.” Integrative Biology (2015).

cross_validate_alpha(alpha, n_folds, condensed=False)[source]¶

Get a Q^2 value for each explanatory value (column) at the given alpha value :param alpha: float :param n_folds: int

when number of folds is the same as number of samples this is equivalent to leave-one-out
Returns:
cv_select_alpha(alpha_range=None, method='modelQ2', n_folds=10)[source]¶

Calculate the cross-validation metrics for a range of alpha values and select the best one based on the chosen method :param alpha_range: list, optional

A range of alpha values to test. Default is a linspace of 50 alpha values from 0.0 to null_alpha
Parameters:
  • method – str, optional The method to use to set the alpha value. Current methods are ‘modelQ2’ and ‘max_posQ2’. ‘modelQ2’ uses the alpha that has the highest Q-squared value for the whole model. ‘max_posQ2’ uses the alpha that has the maximum number of genes with positive Q-squared values. Default is modelQ2
  • n_folds – int, optional The number of folds to use during cross validation. Default is 3. If n_folds equals the number of samples this is equivalent to leave-one-out-validation
Returns:

tuple (alpha, cv_table)

get_nth_window_auc(nth)[source]¶
get_null_alpha(max_expected_alpha=10000.0, min_step_size=1e-09, s_edges=False)[source]¶

Get the smallest value of alpha that returns a lasso coefficient matrix of all zeros

Parameters:
  • max_expected_alpha –

    float, optional

    Largest expected value of alpha that will return all zeros. This is a guess and is dependent on the data. The function will step from the minimum to this value with a step size one power of 10 less than this value

  • min_step_size –

    float, optional

    The smallest step size that will be taken. This also defines the precision of the alpha value returned
Returns:

float

The smallest alpha value that will return all zero beta values, subject to the precision of min_step_size
initialize_params(alpha=None)[source]¶

The alpha value to use for the window. If none is entered the alpha will be chosen by cross validation

get_window_stats()[source]¶
Generate a dictionary of relevant information from a window
N : the number of data points in this window, time_labels: the names of the time points step_size: the step-size of the current model window_size: the size of the window of the current model total_windows: the number of windows total window_index: the index of the window. counts start at 0. ie if the window index is 0 it is the 1st window. If the window index is 12, it is the 12th window in the series.

Called by:

Returns:dict

rank_windows(n_permutes=10, n_bootstraps=10, n_alphas=20, noise=0.2)[source]¶

Run tests to score and rank windows

Called by:

Parameters:
  • n_permutes – int, optional Number of permutes to run. Default is 1,000
  • n_bootstraps – int, optional Number of bootstraps to run. Default is 1,000
  • n_alphas – int, optional Number of alpha values to test if using Lasso. Default is 20
  • noise – float ([0,1]), optional The amount of noise to add to bootstrapped windows. Default is 0.2
Returns:

Swing.Window module¶

class Swing.Window.Window(raw_dataframe, window_info, td_window, explanatory_dict, response_dict)[source]¶

Bases: object

A window object is a snapshot created from the full data. Windows operate independently from each other. Windows should be sub-classed to have network inference specific features and methods.

create_linked_list(numpy_array_2D, value_label)[source]¶

labels and array should be in row-major order

make_edge_table()[source]¶

Make an edge table that can be combined.

permutation_p_values = None¶

The training score is a list of descriptors for how well the model fit the training data for each response variable for the current window the test score is a list of descriptors for how well the model fit the test data for each response variable for the current window.

run_permutation_test()[source]¶

Run the permutation test and update the edge_table with p values. It is expected that this method will vary depending on the type of method used by the window :return:

update_variance_1D(prev_result, new_samples)[source]¶

incremental calculation of means: accepts new_samples, which is a list of samples. then calculates a new mean. this is a useful function for calculating the means of large arrays

incremental calculation of means: accepts new_samples, which is a list of samples. then calculates a new mean. this is a useful function for calculating the means of large arrays
